page.title: 14THORNWOOD VILLAGE
page.content: Thornwood village lies on the roas joining Epping and Harlow,on the edge of the old forest land now called Wintry Wood. Older houses lie scattered about the countryside,or clustered along the road.Small industries-a coachworks, transport and packing firm and tropical fish shop- also lie by the road,or in the new Industrial Estate on the road to North Weald.There is also a sewage works and Council Depot. Houses along the busy road have a blighted appearance in comparison with the estate half-hidden behind the coachworks where most of the life of the village seems concentrated. Apart from the entertainments offered by the pubs and newsagent, there is no post office(closed 8 years) or shop and the road and good bus service draw people away from the village.
